pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:0.5_0: The training rule on attention on the almsbowl
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating almsfood while looking here and there, and they did not know whether people were still giving or whether they had received too much. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.3.1_0: “‘I will eat almsfood with attention on the almsbowl,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.4_0: he should eat the almsfood with attention on the bowl;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood while looking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk32:1.9_0: The second rule, the second training rule on fire, is finished.
